p.p: Three different types of papers are used.
The first and third type is thin and transparent, yellowish in colour.
The third type has a recurring watermark represented by a bell and a symbol made of two wings and different initials i.e. D, G, C. not found in Heawood 1969[1950])

The second type of paper is placed in the middle of the manuscript and it is bluish in colour. The recurrent watermarks here are a lion or a woman with a spier and a shield, both within a rounded framework which is surmounted by a crown with a cross above. Both are variants of watermarks in pl. 31-35 and 400-402, Heawood 1969 [1950]). A second watermark found in this kind of paper is represented by names and dates, i.e. 1832 Clements; 1833 J Rump; PC with an irregular alternation between even and odd pages.
The watermarks in type two and three of paper are so distributed:
Paper Type 1 No watermarks: this kind of paper runs from ff. 1r-59v, f. 68r-v.
Paper type 2: watermark 1 = woman with spier and shield within a crown with a cross above (130 mm height x 80 mm width). It is found at ff.: 61–63, 66, 70.
watermark 2 = lion with spier within a crown with a cross above (150 mm height x 78 mm width). It is found at ff.: 77–79, 83–85, 87–88, 91, 95, 97.
watermark 3 = Clements 1832. It is found at ff.: 64–65, 67, 69.
variant of watermark 3 = B CLEMEN[ts] found at f. 71.
watermark 4 = PC (250 mm height x 410 mm width). Found at f. 73.

watermark 6 = bell (300 mm height x 300/200). Found at: 1st front guard leaf, 3rd front guard/protective leaf, last protective leaf, and ff. 96, 98, 101–102, 106, 108–109, 111, 113, 115, 118, 120–121, 123, 125, 127–128, 131–132, 134–136.
watermark 7 = wings and letters (400 mm height x 540 mm width). It is found at: 2nd front guard leaf, and ff. 93, 99–100, 103–105, 107, 110, 114, 116–117, 119, 122, 124, 126, 129–130, 133, 137–139.

extent.measure: 3 front guard leaves + 139 folios + 1 back guard leaf

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation is on the right upper side of the recto of each folio, no foliation on guard leaves. It is the library foliation in Arabic numbers.

collation.desc: the front cover. Shelfmark on recto.
3 folios = front guard leaf. No foliation. Shelfmark and watermark information on recto. Verso blank.
139 folios = Christian paryers and Catechism. Library Arabic foliation on recto.
1 folio = back guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso.

supportDesc.condition: Apart for the card-board which is loosing, the manuscript is in very good conditions and very legible.

layout.p: The layout of the page is marked with light pencil rows.
There are from a minimum of 21 lines per page to a maximum of 29. The most recurrent number of lines is 22, 24, or 26 lines per pages other numbers are 25 and 27

handNote.desc: Scriptio continua. Only in titles words are separated by hyphen. puḷḷi-s: not regularly used. C+ā, as well as ra are written with a diacritic represented by an horizontal stroke above. ra/ā are differentiated. Periya Ra ற is written with doouble loop. Modern writing. Experienced hand.

decoNote.desc: Usage of single or double horizontal lines for marking the passage from one 'text' to another (e.g. at f. 3v two sets of thin double lines separate pāvaṅkīrattaṉam paṇṇukiṟatukku añcukariyam from t

desc.p: BnF shlefmark in black pencil: "Tamoul n. 564".
Notes: 1. Manuscrit Tamoul (139 feuilles); 2. filigrane du papier (Clements 1832).

additions.desc: The stamp is in the recto of the first folio and in the blank verso of the last folio of the main text. Its size is 200 mm. It contains: Bibliothèque Nationale. MSS. R. F.. It is the stamp in use during the Second Republique (see n° 27 in Josserand and Bruno 1960: 282). It suggests that the manuscript was stamped between 1848 and 1852.
BnF shlefmark in black pencil: "Tamoul n. 564"

p.p: Original card-board covered with animal skin probably goat. The stiff covers (boards) at the front and back of the manuscript are attached to the quires by the cords which are secured by means of channeling. The boards and spine are covered with card-board, probably covered with damp leather that is folded over the edges of the boards forming a turn-ins and glued down. Pastedowns of an initial and a final bifolios onto the inside of the board conceal theses mechanisms of the binding and also the channeling. One initial and one final guard leaf (2 bifolios+1 bifolio not numbered).
21 quires in total: 1st, 2nd, 4th, 7th, 9th quires = quaternion; 3rd, 5th, 8th quires = ternio; from 10th to 12th quires = ternio; front guard leaf = 2 bifolios; back guard leaf = 1 bifolio.

origin.origDate: 1832/1833 (Cabaton 1912). The date is found in the watermarks of some folios (ff. 64–65, 67, 69, 71 – Clements 1832, and 74– 76, 80–82, 86, 89–90, 92, 94 – J Rump 1833).

provenance.p: M. Paul Sier controleur au ministéres as Finances, 42. Rue Pelet à Alfortville. Manuscrits en Tamouls: Tirittrayattukkutan rumajña upadisam XIX seicle, papier. 10 franchi. n°89986.

bibl.p: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois et malayo-polynésiens. Paris: E. Leroux.
Heawood, Edward 1969 [1950]. Watermarks mainly of the 17th and 18th centuries. Hilversum: The Paper Pubications Society.

Josserand, Pierre and Jean Bruno. 1960. Les estampilles du Département des imprimés de la Bibliothèque nationale. In Mélanges d'histoire du livre et des bibliothèques offerts à Monsieur Frantz Calot. Paris: Librairie d’Argences, pp. 261-298.

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Conservative. puḷḷi, ē, ō are marked only if found in the manuscritp. ― Abbreviations ― f. = folio, ff. = folios, r = recto, U/u = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
